title: Merriam-Webster Names 'Slop' As 2025 Word Of The Year Amid AI Content Concerns
description: Merriam-Webster named slop its 2025 Word of the Year, defining it as low-quality digital content produced by artificial intelligence.
content: As artificial intelligence has surged in popularity, the internet has been plagued with low-quality, automated content known as 'AI slop'. Recognising this cultural shift, Merriam-Webster has officially named 'slop' its 2025 Word of the Year. The dic... [2083 chars]

title: Synvo AI and Sobat Bisnis Group (SBG) Forge Strategic Partnership to Bring Secure, Context
description: Singapore/ Jakarta [Indonesia], December 16: Synvo AI, a deep-tech spin-off from MMLab Nanyang Technological University (MMLab@NTU) Singapore, and Sobat Bisnis Group (SBG), a leading Indonesian enterprise technology company with deep ties to the multi-billion-dollar Mayapada Group, announced a strategic partnership to accelerate the commercial adoption of next-generation Artificial Intelligence across Indonesia and Southeast Asia. The core of this alliance addresses the critical market gap for enterprise-grade AI that ensures data sovereignty, long-term context retention, and reliable deployment across complex business environments.

title: Trump Threatens BBC Lawsuit, Says He Urged Xi On Jimmy Lai's Release
description: President Trump said he plans to file a lawsuit against the BBC, accusing the British broadcaster of using artificial intelligence to falsely attribute statements to him.
content: US President Donald Trump said he plans to file a lawsuit against the BBC, accusing the British broadcaster of using artificial intelligence to falsely attribute statements to him, while also revealing that he has personally urged Chinese President X... [2457 chars]

title: Will OpenAI be the next tech giant or next Netscape?
description: Three years after ChatGPT made OpenAI the leader in artificial intelligence and a household name, rivals have closed the gap and some investors are wondering if the sensation has the wherewithal to stay dominant.
content:
NEW YORK: Three years after ChatGPT made OpenAI the leader in artificial intelligence and a household name, rivals have closed the gap and some investors are wondering if the sensation has the wherewithal to stay dominant.

title: How tech’s biggest companies are offloading the risks of the AI boom
description: As demand for artificial intelligence surges, tech giants like Microsoft and Meta are using creative financing and short-term contracts to add computing power while shifting much of the long-term risk to smaller companies and their lenders.
content: They also signalled new ways the biggest companies in tech are manoeuvring to push some of the risk of the AI boom onto the shoulders of upstarts eager for a piece of the action. The moves let companies like Meta and Microsoft add computing power qui... [6863 chars]

title: US government launches campaign to hire engineers for AI, tech roles
description: The US government is launching a major recruitment drive to hire one thousand engineers. These professionals will work on critical government projects for two-year terms. The initiative specifically seeks individuals with artificial intelligence skills. The goal is to bring top talent to tackle complex national challenges. This program aims to fill positions by March thirty-first.
content:

title: OpenAI Deal To License Disney Characters Is Entirely In Stock
description: OpenAI is getting access to Disney’s kingdom without cutting a check. The artificial intelligence company’s recent deal to license iconic characters from Walt Disney Co. for its Sora video app is entirely in stock warrants rather than a cash licensing fee, according to people familiar with the matter. OpenAI will offer Disney the option to purchase shares in the high-flying startup beyond its previously announced $1 billion stake.
content:
OpenAI is getting access to Disney’s kingdom without cutting a check.

title: AI chatbots could help reduce mental health stigma
description: New Edith Cowan University (ECU) research suggests artificial intelligence chatbots like ChatGPT may help reduce mental health stigma, particularly for people hesitant to seek traditional face-to-face support.
content:
